title: TOP 10 HIDDEN GEMS IN YOUR TRACTOR MANUAL!

subtasks: Align front tires with directional arrows
Consider reversing tire lug direction for loader operations to increase tire life and traction
Properly install wheels with valve stems facing outward

tasks.task: Implement safety procedures when stuck in mud
subtasks: Never drive forward when stuck; instead, back the tractor out
Remove mud from behind rear wheels; use boards or similar
Extend service intervals to 6 years or 6,000 hours with annual coolant checks
Regularly apply grease using the Rethink greasing system to prevent leaks and improve machine performance

tasks.task: Seatbelt and roll-over protection system (ROPS) usage
subtasks: Remove seatbelt when ROPS is folded and not in use
Close fuel shutoff valve before transporting on a trailer
Position machine on trailer so hood or engine cover opens from rear
Leveling in reverse: position bucket less than 40 degrees below level to prevent damage
Scrape forward: keep bucket slightly raised or in float position to prevent damage
Re-position rear wheels (up to 8 positions) for maximum lateral stability (51-75 inches wide)
Use offset plate for front wheels, noting limitations when using the loader in wide position
For high piles, remove the top layer first before scooping material
Approach and enter piles with a level bucket.
